title: Abu Dhabi and Dubai braced for rain with daytime temperatures to drop to 24°C
body_text:
Rain is expected in Abu Dhabi and Dubai this weekend with an alert issued for unstable weather poised to sweep across the Emirates.
The National Centre of Meteorology warned of scattered showers and dusty conditions for a week from Friday.
The NCM's online weather map forecasts rain in Dubai, Ras Al Khaimah and Fujairah on Saturday. More rain is in store in those emirates plus Abu Dhabi on Sunday.
The NCM cautioned that winds could pick up speed in the days to come, causing dusty conditions.
The unsettled weather comes as temperatures steadily drop during the transition to winter.
The weather centre's latest five-day bulletin forecasts that temperatures in Dubai – which are set to peak at 31°C on Wednesday – will dip as the week goes on, falling to 24°C by Sunday.
Rain in the UAE – in pictures
Highs of 30°C are projected in Abu Dhabi on Wednesday, with temperatures also set to drop to 24°C by the end of the week.
The UAE receives an average of 8.7mm of rain in the month of December, NCM climate statistics show.
The average daily temperature in the final month of the year – which combines temperatures during the day and at night – is 20.3°C.
